answers.author: Roderick Wood
answers.text:
The some key issues that will arise are:
1.  How is it decided who gets what plot particular if their are more people wanting them than plots available?
2.  How long does a person get to keep a plot, one year or for life or somewhere in between?
3.  People stealing other peoples produce and what is your responsibility to to stop it from occurring?
4.  What do yo do about people not taking proper care of their plot so weeds and infestations spread to other plots?
5. Does a person have to produce every year to retain plot and what if they are ill or injured and how long do they have to get well?
6.  Do they pay a fee for water and what if they are wasting water?

author: Michelle Crandall
text: Does anyone have experience with starting community gardens within neighborhoods.  We have several Civic Associations or Home Owners Associations that have expressed an interest in setting one up.  Ideally we would like these to be "self-governed" by the Civic Association/HOA and the City assist with initial set-up.   Any insight, policies, program descriptions would be appreciated.
title: Community Gardens - In Neighborhoods
